Three things Sanders saysThree things Clinton saysEight years ago, she lost the South Carolina primary overwhelmingly to then Senator Barack Obama.

basic_summary:
Image copyright PA Image caption The Ryanair flight had to divert to BerlinSix British members of a stag party on a Ryanair flight were arrested for allegedly drunken behaviour which forced an unscheduled landing in Berlin, police there say.
The remaining 164 passengers, including the six members of the stag party who were not involved in the incident, were able to continue their journey to Bratislava.
The group of 12 from Southampton were among 170 passengers on the Ryanair flight on Friday evening.
As six of the party, including the groom, became drunk, they ignored crew instructions, a Berlin police statement said.
The groom was among those detained for endangering security when the flight landed at Berlin's Schoenefeld airport.

basic_summary:
Image copyright Getty Images Image caption Five cabinet ministers and a minister who attends cabinet are campaigning for BrexitBritain's top civil servant has been told to explain why cabinet ministers opposing EU membership are being denied access to government papers on Europe.
Last week, Sir Jeremy Heywood issued guidance that the civil service would support the government to make the case for the UK to remain in a reformed EU.
Mr Duncan Smith told the Sunday Telegraph that constitutionally, ministers are in charge of their departments and should continue to receive official documents.
The cabinet secretary will appear before the cross-party Public Administration Committee on Tuesday.
Responding to suggestions he could be replaced in a cabinet reshuffle after the referendum, Mr Duncan Smith added: "If my face no longer fits, my face no longer fits.
name: EU referendum: Jeremy Heywood faces civil servant guidance grilling

basic_summary:
Image copyright Reuters Image caption Several people have been detained, both KKK members and protestersAt least four people have been stabbed in a brawl between Ku Klux Klan (KKK) members and counter-protesters in Anaheim, California, US police said.
The group has a long history in Anaheim, with KKK members elected to the city council in the 1920s.
Thirteen people, both KKK members and rival demonstrators, were arrestedThe violence broke out when several Klan members arrived at a local park for a rally and were attacked by counter-protesters, according to police.
The counter-protests had been underway for hours before the KKK members arrived, witnesses reported.
The Ku Klux Klan is one of the oldest and most infamous hate groups in the US, and has targeted African Americans, Jews, Catholics and immigrants, according to the Southern Poverty Law Center, which tracks hate groups.
name: California Ku Klux Klan rally ends with stabbings and arrests

The fight was finally cooking by the ninth, during which Quigg tagged Frampton with a juddering right hand and a strafing left hook.
Quigg finally started taking a few risks in the seventh, but that only allowed Frampton to show off his defensive skills and pick him off on the counter.
Bury's Quigg, 27, finally came alive down the stretch as the contest turned into a desperate tussle, but Frampton gave as good as he got.
"And the following round was more of the same, with some vicious body shots bookended by two more huge Quigg right hands, which clearly hurt his rival.
name: Carl Frampton beats Scott Quigg on points in IBF and WBA title fight

basic_summary:
The first Gulf War began in 1990 and ended when Iraqi forces were driven from Kuwait in February 1991.
Image caption The monument has paving stones with the names of each person killed during the conflictA memorial remembering the British military personnel who died in the first Gulf War is to be unveiled 25 years after the conflict ended.
The monument, which has 47 paving stones with the names of those killed, will be opened at the National Memorial Arboretum in Alrewas, Staffordshire.
Beneath the centre stone there are 48 poppies, with one poppy for each of the 47 killed and one poppy to remember the veterans who have died since the Gulf War ended.
A US-led coalition fought the Iraqi army during the war after Iraq's invasion of Kuwait was declared illegal by the UN.
name: Memorial for Britons killed in first Gulf War to be unveiled

basic_summary:
Image copyright Reuters Image caption The Swiss People's Party believes the country will be safer if foreigners who break the law are expelledPeople in Switzerland vote on Sunday on whether to automatically expel foreigners who commit minor crimes.
The proposal has been put forward by the right-wing Swiss People's Party.
The Swiss People's Party is now seeking automatic deportation with no right of appeal if a foreigner commits two minor offences within 10 years such as speeding or arguing with a police officer.
The vote comes as unease grows among Swiss people at rising immigration and the social problems which, the People's Party says, come with it.
But if the Swiss do vote yes, they will have adopted some of the strictest laws on foreigners in Europe, the BBC's Imogen Foulkes in Geneva says.
name: Swiss vote whether to expel foreigners for minor crimes

The best supporting actress award went to Mya Taylor, the first trans woman to win at the awards, having starred in the iPhone-shot movie Tangerine.

"The Independent Spirit Awards honour films with a budget of less than $5m.

Tests on 50 people showed being overweight was linked to worse "episodic memory" or the ability to remember past experiences.
Image copyright ThinkstockPeople who are obese have a worse memory than their thinner friends, a small study shows.
The study in the Quarterly Journal of Experimental Psychology argues that a less vivid memory of recent meals may lead to overeating.
The results showed obese people's scores were 15% lower than thinner people.
Tests on rats have previously shown that with burgeoning waistlines come poorer performances in memory tests, but the evidence in humans has been mixed.
name: Obesity linked to 'worse memory'

Image copyright Getty Images Image caption The site of the massive natural gas leak near Los AngelesA scientific analysis of a natural gas leak near Los Angeles says that it was the biggest in US history.
"In terms of the methane release, Aliso Canyon is by far largest," said lead author Dr Stephen Conley, from the University of California, Davis.
At its peak, the flow doubled the rate of methane emissions from the entire Los Angeles basin.
The Aliso Canyon blowout vented almost 100,000 tonnes of methane into the atmosphere before it was plugged.
First detected on 23 October, the leak came from one of the 115 wells connected to a massive underground natural gas storage facility, the fifth largest in the US.

Last year, he told legislators, Gurry dismantled WIPO’s entire internal justice system, and replaced it with a system that gave him an even tighter grip.

name: Patent scandal ensnares what one lawmaker calls 'FIFA of UN agencies'

And John Treadwell, chief of the criminal division at the attorney general's office, urged against passing a bill that would regulate the games and effectively legalize them.
"Our opinion is that daily fantasy sports fall within the coverage of Vermont's gambling statutes," Treadwell told members of the Senate Economic Development, Housing and General Affairs Committee.
"There is an element of chance," Treadwell said, which is why a New York Attorney General Eric Schneiderman's office sued the companies to halt their operations.
name: Vermont attorney general says fantasy sports sites illegal in state
